resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: euca-deregister returns bogus error message when deregistering a malformed image ID

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
Tried with both CentOS 6.3 and Fedora 17 images in eustore and it seems that eustore registers two ERI's:

{code}
[root@g-15-02 ~]# eustore-install-image -b fedora -i 2425352071 -k kvm

comments.body: Start to investigate. Plan to use pdb to trace where the bug is located.

Confirmed issue. Looks like there is issue with the logic in the bundleAll() method. Here is the pdb trace along with the results of the images stored in the bucket:

{code}

{code}

As you can see, there are two ramdisks registered.  Let me know if there is a need for additional information.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Tested this again, and reproduced it.  This time, I narrowed down where the issue is located.  Apparently, we loop through again after we register the EMI, and search for anything that has .img ending.  Since initrd in the tar-gzipped file downloaded from emis.eucalyptus.com has a .img ending, it gets processed again on the second loop. I included the full trace below, followed by a display of where the bug shows up in the trace.

*[Full Trace]*

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# eustore-install-image -i 2425352071 -b fedora-17-x86_64-eustoretest -k kvm
